questions.question: Archimedes' Principle has to do with:

choices.answer: States of matter
Every action having an equal or opposite reaction
The speed of a fluid increasing with the pressure decreasing
Water displacement

questions.question: True or False: Buoyancy is a downward force

choices.answer: True
False
To push something out of the way
To remove a substance
To change the substance
To move something out of the way

questions.question: If the weight of the displaced water is equal to the weight of the object:

choices.answer: The object will sink
The object will float
Distance between 2 objects
Time it takes to reach a certain object
Temperature of an object
Space taken up by an object
An upward force
The amount of matter in an object
The amount of matter per unit volume
The amount of space an object occupies

questions.question: If the weight of the object is greater than the buoyant force, then the object will:

choices.answer: Float
Sink

questions.question: Compared to an empty ship, would a ship full of styrofoam sink deeper, or float more?

choices.answer: Float more because styrofoam collects more air
Float more because it has buoyant cargo
Sink deeper because it's adding volume without adding mass
Sink deeper because its adding mass without adding volume
A downward force made by fluid that an object has displaced
The amount of liquid required to make an object sink
An upward force made by fluid that an object has displaced
The amount of liquid required to make an object float
The shape of the object
The volume of the object
The density of the water
None of the above
